results.title: Strangers in their own land
results.creator_credit: Chris Curling and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines Aboriginal land rights in the Weipa area of Northern Queensland, presenting both sides of the conflict between the Comalco bauxite miners and the Aboriginal people.

results.title: Strangers in Paradise
results.brief_description: Experience the wonder down under - Australia, one of the most exciting, unspoilt and undiscovered destinations left on earth. Tourism is now Australia’s second biggest industry. “Strangers in Paradise” follows a group of American and British tourists on 10 day tour of Australia .. to find out what the tourists think and if the brochures really deliver.

results.title: Stranger's kiss
results.creator_credit: Douglas Dilge, Kill Productions and Matthew Chapman
results.brief_description: Hollywood, 1955, and independent film director Stanley (Peter Coyote) is eking out production day by day on a film financed by gangster Frank Silva, and starring Silva’s girlfriend, Carol (Victoria Tennant) as the leading lady, Betty. Stanley’s film is a love story about a boxer, a gangster, and a girl, and in a case of life imitating art, the leading actor (Blaine Novak) falls in love with Carol/Betty, unbeknownst that she already has a boyfriend who also happens to he a vicious gangster and the financer of the film. This film about a film is supposedly a fictionalised account on what went on behind the production of Kubrick’s “Killer’s kiss”, and has earned comparisons to a later production - Woody Allen’s “Bullets over Broadway” (1994). Cast also includes Richard Romanus and Dan Shor.

results.title: Strange interview
results.creator_credit: Jam Handy Organization and Haford Kerbawy
results.brief_description: The story of Bill Barker, the owner of a small plant, who sees his production falling off and the quality of the work going down. Believing the situation calls for rigid discipline, he sacrifices personal warmth and understanding in his relations with his men. This attitude only aggravates matters until finally, in a dream sequence, Benjamin Franklin makes him see that his human relations can stand a lot of improvement.

results.title: Strange inner tube
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach, Hal Roach Studios, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Del Lord
results.brief_description: A Hal Roach chaotic romp as would-be taxi drivers train using bumper cars. After graduating from taxi school, Billy, Ben and Clyde find themselves involved with a gang of jewel smugglers headed by Frisco Fanny and Flash Fred. Cast includes Billy Gilbert, Ben Blue, Clyde Cook. Charley Rogers, Yola d’Avril, Richard Cramer, Bud Jamison.

results.title: Strange fascination
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of members of the Australian Reptile Club in catching and studying different types of snakes, including tiger, tree, diamond, carpet and black snakes, and also several types of lizards. The film shows an actual snake bite and how such a bite should be treated in the field.

results.title: Strange Days (The Doors)
results.brief_description: “Strange Days” is a song by The Doors. It was released in 1967 and is the first track on the album of the same name. According to a review at AllMusic by Tom Maginnis, the song seems to find lead singer Jim Morrison “pondering the state of the then emerging hippie youth culture and how they are perceived by mainstream or ‘straight’ society”. A visit to New York City by The Doors inspired Jim Morrison to write “Strange Days” and other songs on Strange Days, the band’s second studio album. As with many other of their songs, it was written far before it was recorded; a live version recorded in May 1966 can be found on the album London Fog 1966.
